intro: Raphiocarpus evrardii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with opposite, ovate leaves and produces clusters of bright-colored blooms. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Raphiocarpus evrardii requires well-draining soil and consistent moisture to flourish.
